content: whiskey in a teacup textured triangular shawl description materials this simple easy-to-wear shawlette lets the colour do the heavy yarn lifting while providing just enough texture for a fun knit and an eye- catching finished piece 1 skein gauge dye works mcn fingering shawl 115 g 170 g 4 oz 6 oz specifications 370 m 548 m 405 yd 599 yd 70% superwash merino wool 20% cashmere 10% nylon skills required sample shown requires 115 g 4 oz in whiskey in a teacup this pattern is straightforward and suitable for an adventurous colourway beginner it would be a good introduction to a few intermediate skills yarn over knit two together wrapping yarn around needle needles twice in one stitch knitted cast on one circular needle 60 cm 24 or longer is recommended select a gauge needle size that gives you the gauge and fabric you want see note on gauge 24 sts and 34 row = 10 cm 4 in stockinette stitch after blocking for reference the shawl in the photos was knit using a 4 mm us 6 matching pattern gauge is not critical for this project it s more needle important to create a fabric that you like however if your gauge is significantly looser than specified you may need to omit the last few notions row before the final garter stitch border to avoid running out of yarn tapestry needle kitchen scale optional blocking pins and wires optional sizes and dimensions gauge dye works yarns are available in two put-ups resulting in medium large shawls at gauge given medium width 163 cm 64 depth 36 cm 14 large width 200 cm 79 depth 44 cm 17 sample shown in medium size schematic whiskey in a teacup shawl 2 of 6 gauge dye works notes continue until it is time to begin the border section if you are using the whiskey in a teacup colourway the border is the dark green/grey section the pattern leaves it up to you to decide when to add purl ridges for texture in the shawl body there is no wrong way to do this the border section requires approximately 55% of the total yarn begin the border when the remaining ball of yarn weighs for the sample shawl medium size each stripe is approximately 16 approximately 63 g 95 g 2 2 oz 3 3 oz at this point there will row wide for the larger size the stripes are approximately 20 row be approximately 102 124 stitches on the needles if you feel that you are running out of yarn in the border section you if the yarn transitions to the final colour on a ws row finish this row as can omit some of the shawl border row do work at least four established and proceed to the shawl border section repeats of row 63 and 64 4 garter ridges to prevent the edge from curling if the yarn transitions on a rs row finish this row as established work
